clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between the Analysis of the Rapid Cortical Oscillations, the General Movements of the Preterm's and the Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between the Analysis of the Rapid Cortical Oscillations, the General Movements of the Preterm's and the Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock: The general movement and the electroencephalogram analysis of the preterm have a high predictive value of the neuro-developmental outcome of the infants.

detailed_description.textblock: Compare the technical and the predictive characteristics of the qualitative analysis of the spontaneous motility with those of actual exams of reference diagnosis : magnetic resonance imaging, electroencephalogram and transfontanellar imaging.

primary_outcome.measure: To prove the predictive value of the " Deltas Brushes " triggered by hand or foot stimulation in correlation with the general movement analysis in the cerebral palsy diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: To prove that the general movement of the preterm increases the predictive value the actual monitoring of the preterm's in the diagnosis of cerebral palsy.

arm_group.description: Recording of the movements Recording of the electroencephalogram

intervention.description: Electroencephalogram, recording the movements of the child, RMI, Transfontanel Imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children been born between 15/01/08 and 15/01/10
- children whose term is lower than 28 weeks of amenorrhoea
Exclusion Criteria:
- Born child superior to 28 weeks of amenorrhoea
- presenting child a genic syndrome, an evolutionary neurological disease, a pathology malformative
